issue.title: Docker: Make warning test insensitive to deprecation warnings

repository.name: aiida-core
repository.description: The official repository for the AiiDA code

issue.body:
The Docker image is supposed to configure the profile such that warnings
about using a development version of `aiida-core` and a modern version
of RabbitMQ are silenced. The test was checking that `Warning` did not
appear in the output of `verdi status`, however, this would result in
false positives in case a deprecation warning would be printed due to
downstream dependencies that we cannot necessarily control. The test is
made more specific to check for a line starting with `Warning:` which
should reduce the chance for false positives.

body:
> Same annoying warnings here. paramiko 3.4.0 python 3.11

I have made it ignored by importing warning and doing an 'ignore' filter, but this does not solve the problem since if there are other warnings about libraries this one will not show them

```
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings(action='ignore', module='.*paramiko.*')
```

issue.title: Review TripleDES warning

labels.name: Priority
labels.description: Important, but not the highest priority

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
```
/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.10.14/x64/lib/python3.10/site-packages/paramiko/pkey.py:100: CryptographyDeprecationWarning: TripleDES has been moved to cryptography.hazmat.decrepit.ciphers.algorithms.TripleDES and will be removed from this module in 48.0.0.
```

body:
Issue seems to be from the underlying `cryptography` library being on `43.0.0` where `TripleDES` was moved from `algorithms` to the `decrepit.algorithms`. Works fine if I pin `cryptography < 43.0.0` but would prefer not to if I can ðŸ˜„ 

https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/commit/722a6393e61b3acb569f404218f213fe08478a96

Encountered this just now as well. I'm guessing this is because paramiko accommodates TripleDES cipher in keys:

https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/blob/51eb55debf2ebfe56f38378005439a029a48225f/paramiko/pkey.py#L85-L104

https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/blob/51eb55debf2ebfe56f38378005439a029a48225f/paramiko/transport.py#L221-L263

I think it depends on how the developers want to work around it. I imagine the immediate resolution is to change the references of `algorithms.TripleDES` to the new location, but the warning also states it will be removed altogether in `cryptography` 48.0.0. So `paramiko` may need to implement its own deprecation handling.

issue.title: fix: Update the import path for TripleDES Cipher

repository.name: paramiko
repository.description: The leading native Python SSHv2 protocol library.

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body:
### Changelog
- A new major version of cryptography was released a few days ago and with it, the TripleDES cipher was moved from  the `primitives` to the `decrepit` ciphers as shown below

```python
# Old Import Path
from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers.algorithms import TripleDES

# New Import Path
from cryptography.hazmat.decrepit.ciphers.algorithms import TripleDES
```
- Addresses https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/2419 by adding a conditional import so `paramiko` remains compatible with either version of `cryptography`. 
- Paramiko seems to only have two references to the cipher in `transport.py` <sup>[1](https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/blob/main/paramiko/pkey.py#L99-L103)</sup> and `pkey.py` <sup>[2](https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/blob/main/paramiko/transport.py#L258-L263)</sup> which the conditional import caters to. Considered [bumping `cryptography>=43.0.0`](https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/blob/main/setup.py#L91) <sup>[3](https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/blob/main/setup.py#L91)</sup> but that would likely limit the range of supported clients which I have no insight on

### Breaking Change
- cryptography moving TripleDES from `primitives` to `decrepit` as it should https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/commit/722a6393e61b3acb569f404218f213fe08478a96

### Links
1. https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/blob/main/paramiko/pkey.py#L99-L103
2. https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/blob/main/paramiko/transport.py#L258-L263
3. https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/blob/main/setup.py#L91

### Alternatives
- In the interim, one can pin `cryptography<43` in projects that depend on paramiko until a formal way forward is decided

body:
> So paramiko may need to implement its own deprecation handling.

It should be considered if it's possible to remove TripleDES support entirely. 3DES has been considered to be cryptographically weak for a long time.

It's 2024: AES is so prevalent, I doubt you can find any SSH server that doesn't support AES, but does support 3DES.

It seems OpenSSH disabled 3DES by default in their `ssh` client in v7.4, released in 2016 https://www.openssh.com/txt/release-7.4

>  * ssh(1): Remove 3des-cbc from the client's default proposal. 64-bit
>   block ciphers are not safe in 2016 and we don't want to wait until
>   attacks like SWEET32 are extended to SSH. As 3des-cbc was the
>   only mandatory cipher in the SSH RFCs, this may cause problems
>   connecting to older devices using the default configuration,
>   but it's highly likely that such devices already need explicit
>   configuration for key exchange and hostkey algorithms already
>   anyway.

issue.title: Bump the trader to `v0.17.0`

repository.name: trader-quickstart
repository.description: A quickstart for the trader agent for AI prediction markets on Gnosis

issue.body:
Bumps the trader to `v0.17.0` and addresses the breaking changes.

Unfortunately getting lots of warnings after the update, due to https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/2419.

body: I am using python 3.12 and paramiko v3.4.0. Same issue

> It should be considered if it's possible to remove TripleDES support entirely. 3DES has been considered to be cryptographically weak for a long time.

I agree, but I can't presume to know how the `paramiko` devs want to proceed.
I tried every single version from 3.0, they still has this issue.

**Short-term fix** that worked for me:

Add and/or pin `cryptography<43.0.0` in your requirements until paramiko devs decide on a way forward.

issue.title: cryptography 43.0.0

repository.name: homebrew-core
repository.description: ðŸ» Default formulae for the missing package manager for macOS (or Linux)

issue.body:
Created by `brew bump`

---

Created with `brew bump-formula-pr`.

body: In my environment, the issue was resolved by downgrading cryptography to version 42.0.0.

Same issue here (Python 3.12.3, paramiko 3.4.0, cryptography 43.0.0).

If you are looking for a quick way to temporarily suppress the issue, you could change `import paramiko` to:
```python

import warnings
from cryptography.utils import CryptographyDeprecationWarning
with warnings.catch_warnings(action="ignore", category=CryptographyDeprecationWarning):
    import paramiko
```

This is not a fix but silences the warning message in as targeted a way as possible. You still get other warnings.

Is that how things are done here? Close an issue just because there are workarounds? Surely it should remain open until the underlying cause has been addressed, and not just in the hope that in the next commit the devs will fix it?
How will the issue be tracked and notified in release notes so that people can remove their workarounds otherwise?
I agree, why close this issue? 3DES is considered insecure by NIST and OpenSSL, why should paramiko continue supporting it?
Agreed, this should stay open until actively addressed.
